page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The Hobby Drive which runs from Hobby Lodge to Clovelly through woodland overlooking the sea,was built by Sir James Hamlyn Williams. It was his hobby,hence the name,and it gave work to unemployed men after the Crimean war.It is 3 miles long and is owned by the Clovelly Estate Company,it is part of the coastal footpath.Cars are charged Â£1.20 to drive along it pedestrians are free.Once everyone living at Buck's Mills was called Braund.Now the families are scattered world wide.The Braund society has been formed and is a member of the Federation of Family History Societies.It aims to provide opportunities for members to contact each other and trace the family origin.
